title: Refine and Improve a Prompt
content: Rewrite the following prompt in clear, natural English and enhance it using AI prompt-writing best practices to ensure more accurate, specific, and useful results.\n\n Prompt: {draft}

title: Comprehensive Listing Task
content: List as many relevant items, examples, or ideas as possible related to the following topic or question. Aim for completeness, accuracy, and clarity. Topic: {topic}

title: Identify Effective Frameworks
content: What are the most effective frameworks, methods, or models to {objective}? For each framework, explain its core idea, advantages, and when it is best applied.

title: Decompose a Big Goal
content: Break down the goal '{goal}' into a hierarchy: outcomes → milestones → deliverables → tasks. Include dependencies, required resources, estimated effort, risks, and success metrics. Conclude with a 2-week starter plan that fits {timeframe} and {constraints}.

title: Socratic Tutor Session
content: Act as a Socratic tutor for the topic '{topic}'. Ask me one question at a time, escalating from fundamentals to applications. If I answer incorrectly, give a brief hint and a simpler checkpoint question. Finish with a concise summary and 3 practice problems tailored to my level: {level}.

title: Compare-and-Contrast Matrix
content: Create a comparison matrix for these items: {items}. Columns: criteria {criteria}. Rows: items. Fill with concise, evidence-based notes. Conclude with: (1) key trade-offs, (2) recommended choice for {context}, (3) one-sentence rationale.

title: Explain Twice: ELI5 then Technical
content: Explain '{topic}' in two passes: (1) ELI5 using familiar analogies; (2) A technical explanation for a knowledgeable audience, including definitions, equations or algorithms if relevant, and a tiny example.

title: Reverse-Engineer an Exemplar
content: Analyze this exemplar work: {exemplar}. Identify its structure, patterns, voice, and tactics. Produce a style guide with do's/don'ts and a reusable outline template that would generate similar quality results for {use_case}.

title: Generate Multi-Analogies
content: Create 7 distinct analogies/metaphors to explain '{concept}' from different domains (nature, sports, finance, engineering, art, everyday life, history). For each, state the mapping and one limitation of the analogy.

title: Error-Finding and Correction Pass
content: Proofread and edit the following text for clarity, correctness, and concision. List errors by type (grammar, logic, citation, math), propose fixes, and provide a clean revised version. Text: {text}

title: Reading-to-Notes Pipeline
content: Transform this source into structured notes. Steps: (1) key points; (2) definitions; (3) claims with supporting evidence; (4) open questions; (5) 3 flashcards (Q/A); (6) 1-paragraph synthesis. Source: {source_text}

title: Decision Brief (One Page)
content: Draft a decision brief for {decision}. Include: context, options, criteria, weighted scoring table, top risks, mitigations, and a clear recommendation with next steps for the next {time_window}.

title: First Principles Derivation
content: Reframe the problem '{problem}' from first principles. List assumptions, question each, derive solution paths that do not rely on convention, and propose a minimally sufficient experiment to test the most uncertain assumption.

title: Deliberate Practice Plan
content: Design a 4-week deliberate practice plan to improve {skill} from {current_level} to {target_level} with {time_budget} per week. Include drills, feedback loops, metrics, and weekly reflection prompts.

title: Systematic Research Plan
content: For the question '{research_question}', outline a systematic mini-review: search strategy, inclusion/exclusion criteria, screening steps, data extraction schema, and synthesis method. Conclude with expected biases and how to mitigate them.

title: Fermi Estimate with Sensitivity
content: Provide a Fermi estimate for: {estimation_question}. Show assumptions, a back-of-the-envelope calculation, low/base/high scenarios, and a sensitivity table highlighting which variable drives the result the most.

title: Steelman Counterarguments
content: Given the claim '{claim}', produce the strongest counterarguments from at least three distinct perspectives. For each, list the best evidence, where the original claim is most vulnerable, and what would change your mind.

title: Red Team Review
content: Act as a 'red team' to stress-test this plan: {plan}. Identify failure modes, hidden assumptions, adversarial scenarios, and ethical risks. Provide prioritized fixes and a quick validation checklist.

title: Rubric Builder
content: Create a scoring rubric for {task}. Include 4–6 criteria, each with 4 levels (excellent/good/fair/poor) and behavioral anchors. Provide a one-line usage guide and a sample graded example.

title: Teach-Back Test
content: Teach the topic '{topic}' as a step-by-step mini-lesson for {audience}. Then propose a 5-question teach-back quiz and model ideal answers.

title: Reasoning Summary (No Hidden Steps)
content: Provide a concise, high-level rationale for your answer to '{question}' using 3–5 bullet points. Avoid revealing step-by-step internal thought; focus on key factors, trade-offs, and final conclusion.

title: Multi-Source Synthesis
content: Synthesize the following sources {sources} into a coherent summary. Extract overlapping insights, disagreements, and novel contributions. End with a reconciled viewpoint and 2 follow-up research questions.

title: Reformat to JSON Schema
content: Convert the following specification into a JSON Schema draft-2020-12, including types, required fields, enum constraints, and example instances. Spec: {description}

title: Entity and Relation Extraction
content: From the text below, extract entities (with types) and relations as triples (subject, relation, object). Return JSON arrays 'entities' and 'relations'. Text: {text}

title: Glossary Builder
content: Create a compact glossary for the domain '{domain}' at the '{level}' level (beginner/intermediate/advanced). For each term: definition, why it matters, and 1 example.

title: Misconception Refuter
content: List the top misconceptions about '{topic}'. For each: why it's appealing, what's wrong, the correct view, and a memorable correction analogy.

title: Trade-off Analysis
content: Analyze the trade-offs between {approach_a} and {approach_b} for {context}. Consider cost, complexity, scalability, performance, security, and time-to-value. End with a decision rule.

title: 30-60-90 Day Plan
content: Draft a 30-60-90 day plan for {role_or_goal}. Include learning objectives, quick wins, relationship map, systems/processes to build, and metrics for each phase.

title: Pre-Mortem Workshop
content: Imagine the project '{project}' failed spectacularly in 6 months. List plausible causes by category (technical, people, process, external). For each, propose a prevention or early warning signal.

title: Post-Mortem Template
content: Write a blameless post-mortem for incident '{incident}'. Sections: summary, impact, timeline, root causes (5 Whys), what went well, what went poorly, action items with owners and dates.

title: Socratic Self-Coaching
content: Help me work through this dilemma: {dilemma}. Ask reflective questions to surface values, constraints, and options. After 6–8 questions, summarize insights and suggest a small next step.

title: 4-Week Learning Syllabus
content: Create a 4-week syllabus for {subject} with {hours_per_week} hours/week. Include weekly objectives, readings/resources, exercises, and an end-of-week check. Provide a final project brief.

title: Test-First Spec
content: Write test cases first for the following specification in {language}. Include unit and property tests with clear inputs/outputs and edge cases. Spec: {spec}

title: API Contract Sketch
content: Draft an API contract for {api_name}. Provide endpoints, methods, request/response JSON, status codes, error model, idempotency guidance, and 2 example client calls.

title: Data Cleaning Plan
content: Given this dataset description: {dataset_description}, outline a cleaning plan: schema checks, missingness strategy, outlier handling, normalization, validations, and a reproducible pipeline sketch.

title: Explain a Code Diff
content: Summarize what changed in the following diff and why it matters. Note risks, performance/security implications, and suggested follow-up tests. Diff: {diff}

title: Refactor Plan
content: Propose a refactor plan for this codebase fragment: {code}. Identify smells, propose target design, incremental steps, safety nets (tests), and expected benefits.

title: Performance Profiling Hypotheses
content: For the system '{system_description}', list likely performance bottlenecks, hypothesize root causes, identify key metrics, and propose a profiling/benchmark plan. End with 3 low-risk optimizations.

title: Security Threat Modeling (STRIDE)
content: Perform a STRIDE threat model for {system}. For each category, list threats, impacted assets, likelihood/impact, and mitigations. Provide a prioritized top-5 action list.

title: Decision Tree Builder
content: Construct a decision tree for choosing among {options} given factors {factors}. Show thresholds/branches textually and summarize the implied decision policy.

title: OKR Draft
content: Draft 3 Objectives and 3–4 Key Results each for the mission '{mission}'. Ensure Key Results are outcome-focused, measurable, and time-bounded. Include 2 anti-goals to avoid.

title: Snowflake Story Outline
content: Using the Snowflake method, expand the story/piece '{premise}' from a one-sentence idea to a detailed scene list: sentence → paragraph → character synopses → scene beats.

title: Tone & Audience Rewriter
content: Rewrite the draft for {audience} with the desired tone '{tone}'. Keep the core meaning, improve clarity, and provide 2 alternative openings and 2 closings. Draft: {draft}

title: Summary with Fact-Check Flags
content: Summarize the text below in 5–7 bullets. Flag any statements that look like claims of fact and add a '[VERIFY]' note. Text: {text}

title: Cross-Language Styled Translation
content: Translate the following into {target_language} while matching the style '{style}'. Preserve technical terms and provide footnotes for culture-bound references. Text: {text}

title: Prompt Audit & Risk Check
content: Audit this prompt for ambiguity, missing constraints, and potential bias. Propose improvements and a safer alternative if relevant. Prompt: {prompt}

title: Synthesize Debate & Common Ground
content: Given these opposing positions {positions}, map areas of agreement, precise points of contention, and bridge proposals. Conclude with a joint experiment that could move both sides forward.

title: MVP Scope Cut & Prioritization
content: For the product idea '{product_idea}', define an MVP by removing or deferring features. Use MoSCoW or RICE briefly, list the riskiest assumptions, and propose a single high-leverage user test.

title: Knowledge Gaps Map & Reading List
content: For the topic '{topic}', list prerequisite concepts, current gaps, and a staged reading list (foundational → intermediate → advanced). Include one 'capstone' application task.

title: Back-of-the-Envelope Calculator
content: Quickly estimate '{question}' with a back-of-the-envelope calculation. Show variables, ballpark values, the calculation, and sanity checks. State the main caveat.

title: Memory Palace Builder
content: Turn the items {items} into a memory palace: pick a familiar location, map loci, create vivid hooks for each item, and provide a rehearsal schedule.

title: Visualize a Concept Three Ways
content: For the concept '{concept}', propose three alternative visuals: (1) diagram, (2) timeline/flow, (3) table/matrix. For each, list elements, layout, and the key takeaway.

title: Spaced Repetition Card Generator
content: From the content below, generate 10 high-quality flashcards (active recall, minimal information). Add hints and 'extra' fields for context. Content: {content_block}

title: Heuristic Checklist
content: Create a checklist of heuristics ('rules of thumb') for {domain_decision}. Organize by stage, include a 'when it fails' note for each heuristic.

title: Case Study Template
content: Draft a case study template tailored to {audience} for {product_or_project}. Sections: problem, context, intervention, results (with metrics), lesson learned, and reusable assets.

title: Ethical Impact Scan
content: Assess the ethical implications of {initiative}. Consider stakeholders, consent, privacy, fairness, transparency, and long-term effects. Suggest mitigations and a communication plan.

title: Assumption Inventory
content: List explicit and implicit assumptions behind {plan_or_model}. Tag each as critical/non-critical and testable/non-testable. Propose the fastest test for the top 3 critical assumptions.

title: Algorithmic Walkthrough
content: Explain how to solve '{problem}' with an algorithm. Provide a step-by-step outline, complexity analysis, and a small worked example.

title: Dataset Documentation (Data Card)
content: Write a data card for dataset '{dataset_name}': purpose, composition, collection method, preprocessing, intended uses, known limitations, and maintenance plan.

title: Hypothesis to Experiment
content: Turn the hypothesis '{hypothesis}' into a minimal experiment: variables, control, measurement, success criteria, and timeline. Add likely confounders and how to handle them.

title: Product Requirements Outline
content: Create a PRD for '{feature}'. Include problem, user stories, acceptance criteria, non-functional requirements, risks, and out-of-scope.

title: Customer Interview Guide
content: Write a 20-minute interview guide to learn about {topic} from {persona}. Include warm-ups, core questions, probing follow-ups, and a closing ask. Avoid leading questions.

title: Storyboard the User Journey
content: Create a 6-panel storyboard of the user journey for {scenario}. For each panel: user goal, action, emotion, and friction point. End with two opportunity areas.

title: Heuristic Redesign Suggestions
content: Evaluate the interface/workflow '{ui_or_flow}' with Nielsen's heuristics. List violations, severity, examples, and concrete fixes.

title: Learning-by-Doing Project Brief
content: Design a hands-on project to learn {skill}. Describe deliverables, constraints, evaluation criteria, and a peer-review rubric.

title: Constraint-Based Creativity
content: Generate 10 creative ideas for {goal} under these constraints: {constraints}. For each idea, include why it might work and one small next step.

title: Narrative Arc Mapper
content: Map a narrative arc for '{story}' using a classic structure (Freytag or Hero's Journey). Provide beat-by-beat events and emotional stakes.

title: Rhetorical Style Transfer
content: Rewrite {text} in the rhetorical style '{style}' while preserving meaning. Highlight the stylistic choices used (diction, syntax, devices).

title: Argument Map
content: Convert the following argument into a structured map: claims, premises, evidence, counterarguments, and rebuttals. Return as nested bullets. Argument: {argument}

title: Evidence Strength Rating
content: Given these claims {claims}, rate the strength of evidence (high/medium/low) and explain why. Suggest the single best study or data that would most change the rating.
